vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `aom` package._

In extend_frame_lowbd of restoration.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-11Android ID: A-150780418
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `aom`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-0478)
- [MISC](https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/pixel/2020-12-01)
vulnerabilities.name: aom/libaom0

vulnerabilities.title: Release of Invalid Pointer or Reference
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `aom` package._

aom_image.c in libaom in AOMedia before 2021-04-07 frees memory that is not located on the heap.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `aom`.

vulnerabilities.title: Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

The Apache HTTP Server 2.0.44, when DNS resolution is enabled for client IP addresses, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary text into log files via an HTTP request in conjunction with a crafted DNS response, as demonstrated by injecting XSS sequences, related to an "Inverse Lookup Log Corruption (ILLC)" issue.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2003-1581)
- [http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/313867](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/313867)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Session Fixation
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

mod_usertrack in Apache 1.3.11 through 1.3.20 generates session ID's using predictable information including host IP address, system time and server process ID, which allows local users to obtain session ID's and bypass authentication when these session ID's are used for authentication.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2001-1534)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://cert.uni-stuttgart.de/archive/bugtraq/2001/11/msg00084.html)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/3521)
- [XF](http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7494.php)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Arbitrary Code Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

CRLF injection vulnerability in the mod_negotiation module in the Apache HTTP Server 2.2.6 and earlier in the 2.2.x series, 2.0.61 and earlier in the 2.0.x series, and 1.3.39 and earlier in the 1.3.x series allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks by uploading a file with a multi-line name containing HTTP header sequences and a file extension, which leads to injection within a (1) "406 Not Acceptable" or (2) "300 Multiple Choices" HTTP response when the extension is omitted in a request for the file.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.

vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Numeric Errors
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

The Apache HTTP Server 2.0.44, when DNS resolution is enabled for client IP addresses, uses a logging format that does not identify whether a dotted quad represents an unresolved IP address, which allows remote attackers to spoof IP addresses via crafted DNS responses containing numerical top-level domains, as demonstrated by a forged 123.123.123.123 domain name, related to an "Inverse Lookup Log Corruption (ILLC)" issue.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2003-1580)
- [http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/313867](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/313867)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-bin

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2003-1307
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

** DISPUTED **  The mod_php module for the Apache HTTP Server allows local users with write access to PHP scripts to send signals to the server's process group and use the server's file descriptors, as demonstrated by sending a STOP signal, then intercepting incoming connections on the server's TCP port.  NOTE: the PHP developer has disputed this vulnerability, saying "The opened file descriptors are opened by Apache. It is the job of Apache to protect them ... Not a bug in PHP."
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2003-1307)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/348368)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/449234/100/0/threaded)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/449298/100/0/threaded)
- [MISC](http://bugs.php.net/38915)
- [MISC](http://hackerdom.ru/~dimmo/phpexpl.c)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/9302)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-bin

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2007-1743
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

suexec in Apache HTTP Server (httpd) 2.2.3 does not verify combinations of user and group IDs on the command line, which might allow local users to leverage other vulnerabilities to create arbitrary UID/GID owned files if /proc is mounted.  NOTE: the researcher, who is reliable, claims that the vendor disputes the issue because "the attacks described rely on an insecure server configuration" in which the user "has write access to the document root."  In addition, because this is dependent on other vulnerabilities, perhaps this is resultant and should not be included in CVE.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2007-1743)
- [HP Security Bulletin](http://marc.info/?l=apache-httpd-dev&m=117511568709063&w=2)
- [HP Security Bulletin](http://marc.info/?l=apache-httpd-dev&m=117511834512138&w=2)
- [http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=511](http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=511)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1017904)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Arbitrary Code Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

Apache httpd 2.0.59 and 2.2.4, with the Prefork MPM module, allows local users to cause a denial of service via certain code sequences executed in a worker process that (1) stop request processing by killing all worker processes and preventing creation of replacements or (2) hang the system by forcing the master process to fork an arbitrarily large number of worker processes.  NOTE: This might be an inherent design limitation of Apache with respect to worker processes in hosted environments.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2007-3303)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/469899/100/0/threaded)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/471832/100/0/threaded)
- [MISC](http://security.psnc.pl/files/apache_report.pdf)
- [OSVDB](http://osvdb.org/37050)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/24215)
- [SREASON](http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2814)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Exhaustion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

** DISPUTED **  The Apache HTTP Server, when accessed through a TCP connection with a large window size, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (network bandwidth consumption) via a Range header that specifies multiple copies of the same fragment.  NOTE: the severity of this issue has been disputed by third parties, who state that the large window size required by the attack is not normally supported or configured by the server, or that a DDoS-style attack would accomplish the same goal.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2007-0086)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/455833/100/0/threaded)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/455879/100/0/threaded)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/455882/100/0/threaded)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/455920/100/0/threaded)
- [OSVDB](http://osvdb.org/33456)

vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-data

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2007-1743
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

suexec in Apache HTTP Server (httpd) 2.2.3 does not verify combinations of user and group IDs on the command line, which might allow local users to leverage other vulnerabilities to create arbitrary UID/GID owned files if /proc is mounted.  NOTE: the researcher, who is reliable, claims that the vendor disputes the issue because "the attacks described rely on an insecure server configuration" in which the user "has write access to the document root."  In addition, because this is dependent on other vulnerabilities, perhaps this is resultant and should not be included in CVE.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2007-1743)
- [HP Security Bulletin](http://marc.info/?l=apache-httpd-dev&m=117511568709063&w=2)
- [HP Security Bulletin](http://marc.info/?l=apache-httpd-dev&m=117511834512138&w=2)
- [http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=511](http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=511)
- [Security Tracker](http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1017904)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-data

vulnerabilities.title: Arbitrary Code Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

Apache httpd 2.0.59 and 2.2.4, with the Prefork MPM module, allows local users to cause a denial of service via certain code sequences executed in a worker process that (1) stop request processing by killing all worker processes and preventing creation of replacements or (2) hang the system by forcing the master process to fork an arbitrarily large number of worker processes.  NOTE: This might be an inherent design limitation of Apache with respect to worker processes in hosted environments.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2007-3303)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/469899/100/0/threaded)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/471832/100/0/threaded)
- [MISC](http://security.psnc.pl/files/apache_report.pdf)
- [OSVDB](http://osvdb.org/37050)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/24215)
- [SREASON](http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2814)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-data

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Exhaustion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

** DISPUTED **  The Apache HTTP Server, when accessed through a TCP connection with a large window size, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (network bandwidth consumption) via a Range header that specifies multiple copies of the same fragment.  NOTE: the severity of this issue has been disputed by third parties, who state that the large window size required by the attack is not normally supported or configured by the server, or that a DDoS-style attack would accomplish the same goal.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2007-0086)

vulnerabilities.title: Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

The Apache HTTP Server 2.0.44, when DNS resolution is enabled for client IP addresses, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary text into log files via an HTTP request in conjunction with a crafted DNS response, as demonstrated by injecting XSS sequences, related to an "Inverse Lookup Log Corruption (ILLC)" issue.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2003-1581)
- [http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/313867](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/313867)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-utils

vulnerabilities.title: Session Fixation
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

mod_usertrack in Apache 1.3.11 through 1.3.20 generates session ID's using predictable information including host IP address, system time and server process ID, which allows local users to obtain session ID's and bypass authentication when these session ID's are used for authentication.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2001-1534)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://cert.uni-stuttgart.de/archive/bugtraq/2001/11/msg00084.html)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/3521)
- [XF](http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7494.php)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-utils

vulnerabilities.title: Arbitrary Code Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

CRLF injection vulnerability in the mod_negotiation module in the Apache HTTP Server 2.2.6 and earlier in the 2.2.x series, 2.0.61 and earlier in the 2.0.x series, and 1.3.39 and earlier in the 1.3.x series allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks by uploading a file with a multi-line name containing HTTP header sequences and a file extension, which leads to injection within a (1) "406 Not Acceptable" or (2) "300 Multiple Choices" HTTP response when the extension is omitted in a request for the file.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.

vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-utils

vulnerabilities.title: Numeric Errors
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

The Apache HTTP Server 2.0.44, when DNS resolution is enabled for client IP addresses, uses a logging format that does not identify whether a dotted quad represents an unresolved IP address, which allows remote attackers to spoof IP addresses via crafted DNS responses containing numerical top-level domains, as demonstrated by a forged 123.123.123.123 domain name, related to an "Inverse Lookup Log Corruption (ILLC)" issue.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2003-1580)
- [http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/313867](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/313867)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2/apache2-utils

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2003-1307
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

** DISPUTED **  The mod_php module for the Apache HTTP Server allows local users with write access to PHP scripts to send signals to the server's process group and use the server's file descriptors, as demonstrated by sending a STOP signal, then intercepting incoming connections on the server's TCP port.  NOTE: the PHP developer has disputed this vulnerability, saying "The opened file descriptors are opened by Apache. It is the job of Apache to protect them ... Not a bug in PHP."
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2003-1307)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/348368)

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

Apache httpd 2.0.59 and 2.2.4, with the Prefork MPM module, allows local users to cause a denial of service via certain code sequences executed in a worker process that (1) stop request processing by killing all worker processes and preventing creation of replacements or (2) hang the system by forcing the master process to fork an arbitrarily large number of worker processes.  NOTE: This might be an inherent design limitation of Apache with respect to worker processes in hosted environments.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2007-3303)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/469899/100/0/threaded)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/471832/100/0/threaded)
- [MISC](http://security.psnc.pl/files/apache_report.pdf)
- [OSVDB](http://osvdb.org/37050)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/24215)
- [SREASON](http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2814)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Exhaustion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apache2` package._

** DISPUTED **  The Apache HTTP Server, when accessed through a TCP connection with a large window size, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (network bandwidth consumption) via a Range header that specifies multiple copies of the same fragment.  NOTE: the severity of this issue has been disputed by third parties, who state that the large window size required by the attack is not normally supported or configured by the server, or that a DDoS-style attack would accomplish the same goal.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apache2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2007-0086)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/455833/100/0/threaded)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/455879/100/0/threaded)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/455882/100/0/threaded)
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/455920/100/0/threaded)
- [OSVDB](http://osvdb.org/33456)
vulnerabilities.name: apache2

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apt` package._

It was found that apt-key in apt, all versions, do not correctly validate gpg keys with the master keyring, leading to a potential man-in-the-middle attack.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apt`.

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `avahi` package._

A flaw was found in avahi in versions 0.6 up to 0.8. The event used to signal the termination of the client connection on the avahi Unix socket is not correctly handled in the client_work function, allowing a local attacker to trigger an infinite loop. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to the availability of the avahi service, which becomes unresponsive after this flaw is triggered.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `avahi`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3468)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1939614)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/06/msg00009.html)
vulnerabilities.name: avahi/libavahi-common-data

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35448)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210129-0008/)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26574)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=binutils-gdb.git;h=8642dafaef21aa6747cec01df1977e9c52eb4679)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-24)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1913743)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3549)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1960717)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

stab_xcoff_builtin_type in stabs.c in GNU Binutils through 2.37 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by an out-of-bounds write. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2018-12699.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20673)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24039)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106454)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20673)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010204)

- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190822-0001/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-18483)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35448)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210129-0008/)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26574)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=binutils-gdb.git;h=8642dafaef21aa6747cec01df1977e9c52eb4679)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-24)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1913743)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1913743)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20284)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

remember_Ktype in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30, allows attackers to trigger excessive memory consumption (aka OOM). This can occur during execution of cxxfilt.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS)

- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)

vulnerabilities.description:

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GCC v12.0 was discovered to contain an uncontrolled recursion via the component libiberty/rust-demangle.c. This vulnerability allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) by consuming excessive CPU and memory resources.

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

remember_Ktype in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30, allows attackers to trigger excessive memory consumption (aka OOM). This can occur during execution of cxxfilt.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-9996)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libbinutils

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-9996)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=85304)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/103733)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-9996)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libbinutils

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-13716)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22009)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-13716)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libbinutils

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20623)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24049)

- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4336-1/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20623)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libbinutils

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20712)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20712)

- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24043)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106563)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20712)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20673)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24039)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106454)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20673)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libbinutils

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS)

- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190822-0001/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-18483)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35448)

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1913743)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3549)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1960717)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

stab_xcoff_builtin_type in stabs.c in GNU Binutils through 2.37 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by an out-of-bounds write. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2018-12699.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010204)

- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190822-0001/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libbinutils

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-18483)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=87602)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35448)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210129-0008/)

- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-24)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libctf-nobfd0

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)

- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libctf-nobfd0

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.description:

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

remember_Ktype in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30, allows attackers to trigger excessive memory consumption (aka OOM). This can occur during execution of cxxfilt.

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

## NVD Description

GCC v12.0 was discovered to contain an uncontrolled recursion via the component libiberty/rust-demangle.c. This vulnerability allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) by consuming excessive CPU and memory resources.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-46195)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=103841)

remember_Ktype in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30, allows attackers to trigger excessive memory consumption (aka OOM). This can occur during execution of cxxfilt.

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-9996)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=85304)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/103733)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-9996)

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References

- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)

## Remediation

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35448)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210129-0008/)

- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-24)

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1913743)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

vulnerabilities.description:

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.name: binutils

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-13716)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22009)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-13716)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20623)

vulnerabilities.name: binutils

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20712)

- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106563)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20712)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20673)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24039)

vulnerabilities.name: binutils

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010204)

- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190822-0001/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35448)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210129-0008/)

- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-24)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1913743)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-18483)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=87602)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=23767)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00072.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-11/msg00008.html)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/105689)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4326-1/)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4336-1/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-18483)
